pros: So great to be apart of this organization doing what I love!
cons: Lower pay because of non-profit.

review_title: Best place to be in full time ministry
pros: Tons of opportunities for many different skill sets to contribute, reasonable amount of flexibility to accommodate life, focus on care / development for the staff.
cons: Organizational strategy changes often, so not good for people who don’t like change.

pros:
- Work hard, play hard culture
- Values are kept front and center
- You’ll have a significantly bigger budget that you’ll get anywhere else
cons:
- You’ll often be asked to take on other roles or responsibilities without an increase in pay
- Poor planning as a whole leads to unnecessary scrambling to compensate for poor preparation
- Pay is really low across the board
- People are promoted based on being culture carriers, often with very little results
- Difficult to stay long if you don’t drink the orange Kool-Aid

pros: Resourced well. High octane energy and excitement to serve. Welcoming environment. Good people to work and serve with. Very experienced musicians and team members. Volunteers are the best.
cons: Limited advancement opportunities. Employer to employee expectation gaps. Fraternity leadership culture. Tendency to contract outside leaders that happen to provide mutual benefits rather than spending time and energy identifying and cultivating the people already committed on staff.

pros: All Pros, Fun place to work while stretching your thinking and mindset to grow
cons: None! This place was incredible.

pros: Great culture, great people, great values. Constant development opportunities. Purposeful work. Fun staff activities. Workout facilities. Child Care.
cons: Not great work-life balance. Low pay.  Lots of constant pressure.

pros: Cool looking office, but that's the only pro.
cons: Cult mentality, terrible pay/benefits, no work/life balance (you must give all your time/energy/MONEY to the church), cutthroat and cliquey community, constantly pulling pranks or "fake-firing" people and filming it for reactions.

pros: Great workplace and people! Amazing work-life balance.
cons: Lower pay than you’d get at other labels, but the lighter, stress-free work environment more than makes up for it.

pros: Work culture and excellent health benefits. Easy to find purpose in your work.
cons: Fast pasted, low pay, and supervisor system and development and growth tracks lacking.

pros: Great benefits, mission focused, fun staff environment
cons: Any day off is considered a “blessing” and can be taken from you at any point.

pros:
- Flexible time schedule 
- Friendly colleagues
- Faith-filled work
- Many opportunities to shift and grow in the company
cons: - With virtual work, there's always possibility for technical difficulties

review_title: Lack of appreciation, coordination, communication, & training
pros: High energy people, devoted to eFam and Elevation church. Elevation is using some of the best software available on the market. This is not usual for a non-profit.
cons:
Very political organization. Groups are spread out throughout the US and other countries. Lack of understanding the complete organization structure of the church. I never felt like I was apart of the church mission. I was processing data that I didn't understand. There was no documentation or procedures to assist, just verbal training that was rushed and not lead by professionals. There was always execptions to certain tasks each week. Again, never fully trained. 
 Constant rotation of new team leads. Couldn't keep up with who I was working with each week or the names from the emails. It was a mess. Tried to communicate with other team members about the awesome message that Pastor Steven had delivered and most team members had not watched the sermon or wasn't aware. I asked in the beginning if we could pray before we began training, and I was told that this was not included in the training. The data team was just a job to them. I was definitely not working with Christian leaders.

pros:
- Leadership opportunities
- Fun co-workers
- Diversity of projects
cons: Well, it's a megachurch, which means at the end of the day the business side matters and often contradicts the ministry aspect.

pros: Benefits and Relationships are the best part of this place!
cons: Work Life Balance can be a bit off

review_title: There Is No Better Place To Work
pros: Meaningful work that's impact is felt around the globe, phenomenal coworkers, incredible benefits and perks, and super fun work environment.
cons: If you don't like working hard, you won't like working here but there is a good balance.

pros: Benefits are great! Working in Matthews, there is a fantastic gym on-site.
cons: Non-stop pace! It's a lot to balance work/family if you work at a campus.

job_title: Food Worker/Cashier in East Gwillimbury, ON
pros: good place to work, loving members
cons: i have no cons, its nice

job_title: Youth Leader/Worship Leader in Charlotte C H, VA
pros: Environment fun exciting fantastic fair
cons: Culture busy demanding tired all the time

pros: flexibility, values, fun, family, benefits
cons: long work days, fills your life

pros: Casual Work enviroment with many options to find the job that works best for you
cons: leadership pipeline can be a little confusing to navigate

review_title: Competent and friendly coworkers with selfish, haughty upper management
pros: Modern equipment and ample resources.  Some very talented people working behind the scenes.  A lot of people seem to get personal fulfillment and meaning from participating.
cons: A very superficial, self-involved culture.  The church doesn't just pay bottom-tier low salaries, but they are downright PROUD of it.  They capitalize on people's dedication.    There's almost a caste system of importance, where upper management is coddled by expendable lower employees.  This employer knows no boundaries and expects access to every part of their worker's personal lives.  You will work horrible hours without a moment's notice, and you will be expected to make the job your number one and only priority in life.  The pastor's wife once told us not to be friends with anyone outside the church, so good luck changing the world with that navel-gazing.  I learned useful skills here, but be warned that having a church on your resume may not look impressive to some.

pros: Fun environment. Get to work with cool people.
cons: Impossible work/life balance. Poor compensation. Too involved in your personal life

review_title: It's not just a job, it's a calling
pros: I'm the kind of person who has always got something going. I like to be working toward a goal. I'm fueled by completing a project or solving a problem. I want to be part of a winning team - even if my part is unknown or small. Elevation Church is the perfect combination of these aspirations for me. I feel successful and accomplished as an employee of Elevation because the work that I'm doing is significant and the people I get to do it with feel the same way.
cons: They're only cons if it's not your thing: Ministry never stops so neither can you. We are committed to a high degree of excellence so you can't coast very long before you'll find yourself being confronted by a peer. Sometimes I find myself being over-shadowed by a sense that I don't have what it takes to do the role I'm assigned. Since we're breaking ground in our field often times we're making it up as we go and that can get overwhelming.

pros:
This is a great place for me to work as a wife and as a mother. My schedule is flexible and feel empowered to put my family first. I love having childcare for my child in the same building as a I work, and it's enabled me to continue to work in a full time role.

The people here are amazing. The atmosphere and environment is supportive of us growing as friends, not just co-workers. The expectation is high to get the job done (and get it done well!) but we are given whatever resources needed to accomplish the goal. We are all trying to reach the same goal - so that people far from God will be raised to life in Christ - and it's great to have that foundation as we work together on a day-to-day basis.
cons: There aren't many! We're all very competitive and sometimes that comes out in our "Game of the Month" and sometimes it comes out in meetings. We love confrontation and are willing to go through awkward conversations in order to get the desired end goal!

pros: Had some fun times while working there.  I grew a lot in my skill set.  Get to work for a purpose.  It can be a good creative outlet.  If you fit the culture and buy in to what they believe 100% you may have a good experience working there.
cons: Very demanding.  They don't care much about your life outside of work.  The vibe was sometime weird for me.  They treat their pastor like he is a celebrity or inhuman at times.  If you don't fit the culture they don't really care much for you.  It was sad to be apart of a christian church that didn't really value you as a person or an employee.  Can't even count the times that I stayed overnight or worked way too many hours.  Felt very under appreciated and used most of the time.

pros:
My favorite part of working at Elevation is that we are family.  The people I work with are the same people I want to hang out with outside of work.  We are in this together, working for the same cause.  We support each other in difficult seasons and celebrate each others successes. 

Working in the creative department we are given a lot of freedom to create and encouraged to bring new ideas to the table both in our work and as an organization. I love that we are trusted to run with projects and don't have to necessarily ask permission to try new things.
cons:
We move fast, being on this staff is not for the faint of heart.  Resilience and initiative are must haves to be successful here. 

Our leadership team provides plenty of support.  We have things like fitness challenges, a gym, fitness classes on site, day care, staff family parties 3 times a year, and staff labs were we receive staff development teaching that all make working here even more incredible.

pros: As someone who is on staff and my spouse is on staff, Elevation Church has been an incredible place for our family. Just a few of the perks include affordable on-site childcare, quarterly family-oriented parties, summer camps on-site, and children are welcome to come in and visit the office. Our staff kids get a front-row seat to all that God is doing in our church. We are also offered fitness classes and experts are often brought in to speak to the staff about everything from first-time home buying and nutrition consulting to parenting and marriage. Another pro is getting to work in a place where I am constantly challenged to grow in my field, stay cutting-edge, and work hard to move God's kingdom forward. I couldn't imagine living out my calling anywhere else.
cons: As other reviewers have said, this is not 9-5, but I find it much more fulfilling than past roles in corporate and non-profit circles. I wouldn't want to give my life to anything else, so our family has worked hard to make it work for us.

pros: The work environment is very open, collaborative, energetic, and fast paced. For me that's a great thing.  Having been a part of the church before I came on staff, I was expecting to be let down by what I found once I was on the "inside".  Nothing could be farther from the truth -- the integrity, transparency, and urgency with which the leadership and staff run to reach those far from God is at an even higher level that I observed from the outside.  The culture, benefits, excellence, and lack of politics are unlike anything I have ever experienced.  What God is doing here is nothing short of miraculous.  The unity of the staff is so amazing and I believe there is no greater calling than this.
cons: I see this as a positive but some may not --- the culture is very polarizing.  You either love it or don't. No in between.

pros: Coming from the corporate world, it is refreshing to be a part of an organization where success is much deeper than the interests of stockholders or the bottom line.  The office environment is invigorating & fun to be around.  I am constantly being stretched to improve how I lead and work with others.
cons: This is not a job for the faint of heart.  In fact, if you see this as a job, it will be difficult to embrace the culture of our staff.  It must be a deep calling to work and integrate your life here.  It is also a different rhythm to work on the weekend when traditionally that would be downtime.

pros: I've been working full-time at Elevation Church for a year & a half. I had the privilege of being an intern and then coming through the apprenticeship program before coming on staff full time. The culture and relationships here are energizing and inspiring. I've never been in an environment where people genuinely care about you and your constant development/growth as much as they do here.
cons: This isn't just a workplace, it's a family that you're joining, (which is actually a pro unless you're only looking for a job to clock in/out of everyday). But your entire household needs to be on board and passionate about being part of the staff family. Having a "halfway in/out" mentality will not help you thrive in this fast paced environment.

pros: Unparalleled impact potential, creative role options, phenomenal post-job reference opportunities. It’s a productively polarizing culture that makes you choose to commit to the mission or not ... which is the best kind of culture so it doesn’t allow for mediocre employees who anonymously rant on websites about circumstances caused by their lack of drive. It’s also an insanely generous organization having paid optional severance, not an entitlement; they provide ping pong tables for people to play 6 hours a day while contemplating their next 18-month job stint; they provide literally worldwide exposure for Creatives and others who can build their reels which benefit them when they quit. They have given away over $50MILLION in outreach to communities and mission projects in just 14 years. It’s SEAL school, not preschool!
cons: There’s a certain grace that keeps negative people employed longer than necessary.

pros: Elevation Church is an exciting place to work. The people that work here are dedicated, talented, and passionate about what they get to do. The office culture is a lot of fun, with a gym and fitness classes available, staff competitions, and frequent staff parties. There are perks like on-site haircuts and childcare. It's fast-paced so it's great for people who like a challenge and enjoy having new opportunities. The company's vision makes it a rewarding place to work, knowing that you're doing good in the world through your job.
cons: With the pace at which the organization moves, you have to be a flexible person to thrive here. Change is constant, and can often occur last minute.

pros: I find meaning in what I do everyday - I get to see people's lives transformed on a daily basis.  The staff feels like a family.  I get to be close to my kids, thanks to the on-site employee childcare.  It's a fun environment - fitness challenges, quarterly gift cards, game of the month, craft of the month, and on-site service options like hair cuts, car detailing, etc.  We work hard, we play hard.
cons: Our schedules aren't 9am- 5pm.  For those who are called to ministry full-time, there's an understanding that what we do doesn't always fall within the typical workday.  We get to see life change regularly, and most of the time it happens outside of the "normal" workday.

pros: Your staff is your family. The volunteers are invested and honoring. You get to see a behind the scenes look at what God is doing and hear stories of God changing people's lives. There's always something fun going on, and the staff is intentional about working hard and playing hard. We're intentional about creating moments to laugh together and invest in each other. We are all unified under the same vision. We know that what we do is making a difference in our community and our world.
cons: It is a sacrifice to be on staff. It does take the majority of your time, focus, passion, and energy, but it is worth it. You need to be invested and called.

review_title: Culture of Unhealthy Lack of Boundaries
pros: Honestly - not a ton. Weekly all-staff meetings make you feel like you're a part of something big. On-site childcare (if they have the space). Easy and free on-site parking. Subsidized healthy snack machines. Stocked kitchens with high-end coffee makers.
cons:
Creative roles will work 50+ hours/week easily. Office hours are technically Monday-Thursday 8-5, but if you leave at 5:00pm you will be judged and your supervisor will mention it in a formal or informal review. The main reason for having to work such long hours is extremely poor time management. While each team might have a project manager, leadership and upper management demand world best quality work that requires a lot of time. Video teams will be in the office during the day, then go do video shoots at night when volunteer actors are available. Audio editors will spend all day working on projects, then often times have to spend the night in their studio making edits based on feedback they received at 4:30. Writers will only get 500 words done in a work day because of all the meetings they'll be required to attend, but then be penalized for not getting enough stuff accomplished in the 90 minutes of actual desk time they might have. 

Don't bother applying if you're LGBTQ+ - this is not an affirming church. 

If you're young and single, you're only real option for relationships is with other staff members which becomes incredibly complicated and dramatic most of the time. Leadership actively encourages staff members to cut out exterior relationships in order to maximize their time in the office and with their "church staff family". 

Don't let the loud music and cool outfits trick you - this is a fairly conservative organization. Their culture of "being known for what we are for" translates to not taking a stance on what many young people find important - women's rights, LGBTQ rights, rights for DACA recipients and other social justice issues. They choose to stick to "uncontroversial" issues like soup kitchens, tutors, disaster relief (all good things, but could do more).

pros: Leadership really believes in staff the succeeding. Plenty of opportunity for staff to grow in leadership. And it's extremely fun and creative environment to work in. Lots of community among staff.
cons: Not many that I could honestly put here. We work hard and play hard and have a fast paced culture. Because of that, I think your success here and enjoyment of what you're doing here is largely associated with how "called" you are to be a part of elevation. If it's just a "job" then there's a likelihood of you burning out sooner or later. But if your called to it, it's going to be one of the most fulfilling things you could invest in.

pros: Fun environment for some, most of the team feels like family.
cons: The hierarchy of the organization promotes very unhealthy leaders, making this organization feel like a dictatorship. There is no value put on the hard work of the employees. There are two sides to working there, the church side and the business side. The church side will guilt you into working hard while the business side will run you to the ground with no scrupules.

pros: Visionary leadership. Your job and your life have a purpose far above and beyond a career or making money--you're making a difference and you're changing the world. Being a part of the staff family is an absolute blast and Pastor Steven and the lead staff are incredible about consistently investing in the staff and their families. Your spouse and kids are a part of the family just as much as you are. The work environment is fun, upbeat, flexible. You are not micromanaged but empowered to lead and grow. Pay is commensurate with churches like this and the benefits are AMAZING.
cons: It is a whole-life commitment, which is hard for some people to make. Your family has to be ready to be all-in together, or trying to find a balance will burn you out.

pros: I've never found a place where the work I do makes such a difference in other people's lives.  And I get to do it with people I like hanging out with.  We have a lot of fun and freedom to use the unique skills we've been given to do work that matters.  The benefits are great and on site child care is a huge plus.
cons: We work very hard and a lot of things come up last minute and not between 9-5.  It is a lifestyle and you and your family have to understand that and adjust to work there for a long time.  It allows us to be who we are and make the difference we get to make but it's not for everybody.

pros: I love a good challenge. The demand for excellence, opportunities to grow and improve in your  respective position and investment back into your personal growth are the best parts about the job. No two days are the same. Coming to work is a joy and something I enjoy every day.
cons:
It's not about work/life balance. It's about integration. Being a part of the Elevation Church staff family means that their are opportunities for families to be engaged in ministry together.

It's not just a job. We're not Monday - Friday from 9:00 - 5:00 gig. I can't get enough, so for me -- I love this. But people who want to check in and out of work and leave 'it' at the office this wouldn't be the position for you... You'd miss out on too much good stuff.

pros: Nothing beats getting up in the morning and wanting to go to work... Every day.  That's what you get when you work at Elevation Church.  You get to have a job and get paid to do what you love, to be around the most loyal, funny, passionate people, and to innovate and build.  It's a job with a purpose.  There's no where better to work.  From game of the month, to health fitness challenges, to being one giant family, to staff teachings with Pastor Steven, to the free workout room at the office, the perks just keep going!
cons: Every "con" I attempt to think of can't stand up against the purpose behind what we get to do. It's all worth it.

review_title: It changed my life, now I'm helping change others' lives.
job_title: Associate Campus Pastor in Gastonia, NC
pros:
We are all centered around one focus, seeing people far from God raised to life in Christ. We all work hard to accomplish that, but have fun while doing it. We are so blessed by a Pastor that wants us to be a successful family ministry so date nights are provided, ridiculously cheap childcare, and family events multiple times of the year. 

The culture is the best!
cons: We work hard, very hard. But when you're doing it for Jesus, there's no greater purpose or motivation to sustain you.

pros: Elevation is a very fast paced, quickly growing place to work. Leadership is always finding new ways to make working here even more enjoyable. Coffee / Snack machines, game of the month, mini fitness center, just to name a few. Because we believe deeply in what we do, it feels more like a calling than a job.
cons:
The schedule can be hectic at times, but it's not much different in any other company in my type of role. At least we have more purpose than others. 

Also, most of the staff is very young, so we are all still learning how to work with each other without being ignorant of the other person's role or letting selfishness or preference get in the way of what needs to be done.

pros: I fully believe that this is one of the greatest places to work in the world. I get to use state of the art technology to help thousands of people engage with a worship song or sermon while leading volunteers. Watching a volunteer get excited about serving is enough to keep me motivated for years.
cons: Sometimes there can be an attitude that we are the "only" church or that things can "only" be done our way. I do not see this, but have seen it negatively impact people and them leave staff.

review_title: Inspiring and unforgettable, but results in very few opportunities.
pros: The culture is fun, it is incredibly inspiring, and you will learn a lot. 1-on-1 mentorship with staff/leaders. For the most part the staff are friendly. They will challenge and inspire you to grow personally, spiritually, intellectually. They will push you as it is part of the culture there. They work hard and play hard, and are proud of it. Made lifelong friends who I can trust with my life. I will never forget my time there. You feel like you are making a difference! Front row seats available at broadcast location, free gym, living space provided if you are an intern.
cons: Internship advertisement was very misleading. Did not have any opportunity to participate in any of the activities/duties/jobs advertised. Though I still enjoyed my time there, I struggled to understand what my role was. Though they say it is a "Safe place to fail," I never felt like that was the case. Due to this, I didn't find that there were any tangible career opportunities furthered by my time there outside of the ministry field. Also, there is really no barrier between work/life. This is forgivable considering that the internship is only about 3.5 months long, and works well for those whose friends are fellow staff members. For those on staff with outside family/friends, this may be an obstacle.

pros: I love working at Elevation. It's a very exciting atmosphere that is driven and unified in purpose. Family is integrated into most everything, which allows access to community in many different directions.
cons: One of the things that people tend to struggle with on staff is the pace of work/life. This definitely isn't an environment for people who like hard-cut separations from their 9-5 jobs. As with any ministry position, we are on call 24/7.

pros: Our core values include commitments to generosity and excellence in everything we do. These values guide us in how we relate to others, as well as how our employer relates to us. It means we care not just about taking care of one another, but we also consistently reach out into the community to care for those in need.
cons: Working here is more than a job, it's a lifestyle where compassion and caring for one another are cool. But expect to be stretched and challenged in every area of your life, from physical and financial fitness to personal productivity and nutrition.

pros: You work with a team of the best leaders, always pushing forward to grow and be better. You are a part of life change through your hard work and commitment. Your development is a major priority and you are given the opportunity and charge to develop others.
cons: Like with any thing, there is an adjustment to your rhythm that comes with a new experience. To be a part of the team means to open the throttle of your potential and move full steam ahead to grow the church, your peers, your teams and your self. We work hard.

pros: You would be lucky to find a place that will have the ability and desire to develop you more than working at Elevation. I've worked several places but have never worked somewhere with so much intention and direction behind every decision.
cons: It's not a place for the faint. Elevation has a way of weeding out those who can't keep up, just be ready if you want to jump on - it's not going to slow down to catch you up.

pros: Elevation Church creates a fun and engaging environment to work in. Our supervisors focus on our development and as a result I have grown immensely as a leader and I know that I am playing a part in seeing people's lives changed. I want to continue to reach as many people as possible and for as long as possible with this church. It's an honor and privilege to call this place "home".
cons: Working here comes out of a place of conviction and calling. If you're called here than this will be the most fulfilling thing place you've ever worked in.

pros: Fun atmosphere mixed with a sense of purpose and confidence knowing that what you do every day legitimately matters. Great people, very intentional about involving the whole family and giving opportunities to be together. Word hard and play hard.
cons: Sometimes it's hard to turn your brain off. When you do this type of work, it's difficult to NOT think about it, so it can seem overwhelming at times. Elevation Staff runs at a very fast pace, so it can be hard to onboard effectively as a newcomer. But even then, the staff realizes this and is intentional about helping and being available.

review_title: Elevation Church is the best place to work!
pros: I love our staff culture. In order to be successful at Elevation you have to work hard. I pore my all into what I do but its awesome to be constantly pored back into through the people I get to work with. We have a lot of freedom to get our work done while having the space to play hard as well.
cons: The biggest frustration to me has been some of the last minute request and changes to schedule. I have learned to be more flexible and sometimes expect for things to change.

review_title: Unlike any place I've ever worked
pros: Vision. Purpose. Family-Oriented. Challenging. Fun. I love the culture, love the people I get to work with, and love the incredible opportunities that are afforded to me because of my position in staff. Best place in the world to work!
cons: You stay busy...really busy, but it's worth it. My part-time position often requires full-time hours, but wouldn't change it. You know you love your job when you can say that.

pros:
Best Job in the world- connecting people to Jesus
Great staff culture
Great and lasting friendships
Constant Development
Same, strong vision
Constantly trying to improve
cons: Just like any business, sometimes working with people can get messy, but overall not a lot of cons.  It's important that you are a great staff fit.  It's never that you are not good enough, but are you the best fit (for you and the church) for the team.

pros: I love the staff culture and family vibe here. We get to use our gifts to further God's kingdom. Nothing better than knowing your day to day work is going to impact or change someone's life.
cons: This is a terrible career but an awesome calling. We work hard because what we do matters but we also play hard so people's feelings can get hurt if you are competitive ;)

pros: Love the ownership I am given in order to reach people far from God.  There is a level of freedom to work within the systems given in order to reach initiatives through multiple strategies.
cons: We are fast paced and positioned for growth. If you are not ready to be in full time ministry this isnt the place for you.  Full time means lifestyle and if ministry isnt a lifestyle then Elevation is probably not for you.

pros: One of values that make Elevation Church so unique is the emphasis on unity. Our entire staff feels called to the same mission, vision, and values. This enables us to move with clarity and precision, and eliminates a lot of frustration caused by lack of focus.
cons: This isn't a con but working here isn't a career, it's a calling. Our staff, with their families, want to see God's mission fulfilled and we have given our lives to that mission. However, we know that isn't for everyone.

pros: There is something special about being able to see the impact of your work every week. Elevation church not only provides the opportunity to have a job where you get to feel the impact of your work, but you get to do it with the most incredible people and leaders in the world.
cons: There is a weight that comes with leading people and being apart of one of the fastest growing churches in the world. Just like a successful and growing business, you better be prepared to work hard.

pros: We see life change up close and personal on a weekly basis. We are impacting other churches from around the world by giving them tools to help them in their ministry. We are intentional with everything we do whether its guest experience, our children ministry or even training. We truly believe and train us future leaders.
cons: We get coverage in the media that are made up so its hard to go through that when we are misrepresented.

job_title: Guest Experience Director in Charlotte, NC
pros: Great facilities to work in, access to quality gyms and classes, tons of free food, access to affordable childcare, working with quality people.  Tons of opportunities for feedback - you will grow as a person in the environment.
cons:
Simply, the hours and the lack of autonomy.  There was zero space to have friends or any hobbies.  UNHEALTHY.

I was with Elevation for a year and a half.  Ultimately made the decision to leave when I realized it would be impossible for me to have friends outside of EC, have a family, and be apart of a "growing church".  The emphasis was always on growth and numbers -which I respected because it kept us accountable.  However, there was no work life integration.  

If you had any interests outside of what the church was doing - it was wrong and you were asked to not do it and judged for having "conflicting priorities".   You cannot work at Elevation Church and have healthy boundaries with anything outside of the church - UNLESS - other staff are doing too.  Like having a volleyball team or signing your kids up in dance.  If its not just you - its appropriate.  

On a campus level - I only had one day off a week and sometimes not even that.  You could say no, but it came with consequences.  To be completely practical - I had to cancel my gym membership because every time I tried to go - it was closed.  I lost friends because they did not go to my campus or to the church at all and I did not have time to see them.  When I did see them I was so distracted - I would not have been my friend either!  I was told that I might not be able to go to my only brother's wedding because of what the church had on the calendar.

review_title: What an amazing place to work!
pros:
In my opinion, I couldn't imagine working anywhere else! 
We are family.
I've never worked somewhere like this where I enjoy all the people I get to work with! We're always learning, always doing something new and there are new challenges around every corner. We are invested in as a staff in so many ways.
cons: Our work/life balance is about integration and bringing your family on board. There may be people who have a hard time adjusting to that.

pros: Great place to work. People are on the same side. Politics and infighting is a minimal. Safe place for family to be involved. Fair opportunity for raises.
cons: Lower pay for demanding work. Easier for men to work in leadership than women. All holidays are work days. Sometimes communication lacks clarity and timeliness.

pros: The people who work here are family. They care for each other like none other. We work hard and we have fun doing it.
cons: Work hours and expectations are ever changing - don't expect this to be a 9:00-5:00 job. Your family has to be along for the ride with you. Ministry is full time - it is part of your life - you don't always get to leave work at work.

pros: This is the most rewarding place to work that I've ever seen. Every day you know you're making a difference in the world, and you get to have a lot of fun doing it. There are new challenges every day that make the intense workload feel fresh and exciting, reminding you that what you're doing is innovative and groundbreaking.
cons: The days go by too fast!

review_title: Best Place to Work. Hands Down!
job_title: Family Pastor in Seven Mile Fd, VA
pros: We genuinely get to work hard and play hard. We have a great group of senior leaders that consistently invest in our team.
cons: I love working here. As an organization grows, communication becomes critical. We can probably improve the way we communicate critical information.

pros: We believe our work is making a difference in peoples lives. Its not about a job, its about being part of a move of God that is growing and reaching more people everyday!
cons: Our Culture is specific and is not for everyone. We work hard and have fun while we work. We are growing quickly and figuring things out as we go but i wouldn't want to work anywhere else.

pros: This is the best work environment I could ever imagine. It is fast paced and always pushes you forward but it makes you the best person you can be. I never imagined working at a church would be like this but it is truly the best place in the world to work.
cons: You have to be "all in". This isn't a job you work 9-5. This is a family ministry.

pros: Working at Elevation Church is like it's own family. We work super hard and always have fun too. There is a spirit of empowerment and growth in every department. You will learn and grow so much from your supervisors as well as your peers.
cons: Some unpredictable work hours and the majority of our work is done on the weekends. (It's what we're about though so it's super fun too!)

review_title: I did not know working at a church could be like this..
pros: Amazing workplace atmosphere, fun and exciting staff, strong vision and culture. I come into work everyday excited and expectant.
cons: There are no cons noteworthy. The work hours can get long - but we are a young staff and there are always people around you running at the same pace!!

pros: Elevation Church is the best place to work because we see the fruit of our work every weekend. It's easy to run hard and give it your all when you love the people you work with and the ministry you are apart of.
cons: If you are not positioned to receive feedback and grow from it, you'll definitely struggle here.

review_title: Wouldn't want to be anywhere else!
pros: I can't believe I get to do this with my life. The staff culture at Elevation is incredible. It's fun, fast-paced, innovative and generous. This staff is family.
cons: This is a family calling, make sure that everyone is on board :)

pros: Work hard and play hard, Game of the month, fitness challenges, and being a part of changing lives all over the world.
cons: We do change things on the fly but always have the why behind the change.

pros:
I love going to work every day. 
The vision is clear and everyone is invested. 
It feels like one big family.
I am continually learning new skills and growing.
Health and wellness is a priority.
cons: This is a fast pace working environment that can be overwhelming if you're not prepared.

pros: Elevation is a fun, creative, family focused place to work.  The leadership places huge priority on caring for you and your family as a whole. They even provide onsite childcare for employees.
cons: It is a lifestyle commitment. More than just a job but in a good way.

pros:
-Empowering place of employment
-Challenging and rewarding
-Work hard, play hard
-Fulfilling
-Kingdom Impact - What we do matters. It makes a difference in people's lives. 
-Work is my community. My co workers are also my best friends.
cons: There are not many negative things to say about working at Elevation Church.

pros: Great place to work. No complaints.
cons: Nothing worth noting. Ministry is ran by people so with that comes confrontations and disagreements. But that is life.

pros: staff culture, leadership trainings, family involvement.
cons: if you don't have thick skin you might not enjoy staff culture.

pros:
The Culture
The Staff
The Vision 
The Community 
The Fun
cons: It is very intense and if you are not use to coming from such a background you may find it a bit overwhelming.

pros: It's a great place to be.
cons: Criticism is hard to find.

pros: Great benefits, passion for the vision, great staff, fun place to work
cons: Intense pace and high expectations -- worth it if you can handle it!

pros: Great work environment. Fun atmosphere with strong culture.
cons: Events are pretty much non stop, so make sure you integrate your calendar fully.

pros:
Rewarding. 
Great coworkers. 
Millennial friendly. 
Learning potential.
cons:
Long hours at times. 
Involves most weekends but this is a church so makes sense. 
Fast paced. Very fast.

pros: Loved working here. Great people!
cons: There weren't any cons really.

pros: Praise God!! Amazing place to work and worship!
cons: still learning and growing

pros: A very positive work environment.
cons: Salary is lower than similar occupations in other fields.

pros: You are constantly being developed as a leader.
cons: I really dont have anything bad to say

pros: learn a lot about the back end of a non-profit
cons: it's not what you expect going into it

pros: Mvanadium Core had a healthy working environment
cons: Mvanadium Core benefit was not so good

pros: Progressive and Innovative non-profit organization
cons: No cons at this time
